text:
This occurs when executing large build files using the XmlLogger. When not using
the XmlLogger, everything executes accordingly.

The quite new version of ant is necessary to execute JUnit 4 tests.

The error occurs also when the targets do not include the junit-related targets
(i.e. run the build only).
creator: f.meissner@web.de
peterreilly@apache.org
text:
Please try to provide an example ant script that shows
the problem. Try to reduce the "huge" script to a nicer
small one.

Hi,

I tried to reproduce this with large projects public available but did not get
something useful :(

I thought about to break up the buildfile into smaller pieces but this is
difficult, because the project builds several pieces coming from an
eclipse-related framework.

I try to find something and keep you informed.
creator: f.meissner@web.de

text:
Even I get the same error, when I try to build the project using 
cruisecontrol. The manual build works ok. But till now I had been including 
the JUnit test cases too. But I tried removing the JUnit test cases triger, 
and this problem popped up.
I doubt if its the avoiding of JUnit tests that causes this problem.
java.lang.RuntimeException: Mismatch - popped element = task:ant finished 
target element = target:update

Sajeesh.S
creator: krssajeesh.cruise@gmail.com
peterreilly@apache.org

text:
IMHO this is not related to OOMs. I could reproduce the problem with our
buildfiles with huge memory given in the mx-parameter of the JVM (say, 2GigaByte).

Unfortunatly, these buildfiles are very dependent on our whole build process, so
I can not share them.
creator: f.meissner@web.de
bodewig@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 25086 ***
